meanings.sent1: I had to reclassify my books by genre to keep them organized.
meanings.sent2: The librarian needed to reclassify the books after the library renovation.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally reclassified my socks as kitchen towels in the laundry.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to reclassify memories into neat little boxes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to reclassify the animals based on their habitats.

meanings.definition: To assign to a different category or group
meanings.sent1: The museum curator had to reclassify the artifacts for the new exhibit.
meanings.sent2: The scientist decided to reclassify the species based on new DNA evidence.
meanings.sent3: The aliens tried to reclassify humans as pets, causing chaos on Earth.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions seemed to reclassify themselves into a jumble of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The manager had to reclassify the products to better suit the customers' needs.
